sn12.22:2.1: “Stripped of patchwork” is ironic given that this is, in fact, a patchwork discourse. This passage appears at MN 22:42.1, where it has a meaningful context. The following section on arousing energy is another patchwork, this time of passages from elsewhere in the canon on arousing energy.
sn12.22:2.2: This sentence is not entirely coherent. The opening phrase is normally followed by “those who”, while alameva (“quite enough”) follows the accusative, not the locative.
sn12.22:3.1: Elsewhere we find, “in a well explained teaching and training a lazy person lives in suffering” at AN 1.325:1.1, and “mixed up with bad, unskillful qualities” at AN 3.40:2.11.
